did.head: Summary Information

repository.label: Repository

corpname.normal: Indiana University, Bloomington. Archives of African American Music and Culture

repository.corpname: Indiana University, Archives of African American Music and Culture (AAAMC)

did.abstract: Collection consists primarily of interview transcripts, program transcripts, and artist publicity materials used in the production of the Westwood One Radio programs Special Edition, That's Country Music, Rock Chronicles, My Top Ten, and History of Rock 'n Roll. It also contains materials from various specials including programs on Elvis Presley, Jimi Hendrix, and the Rolling Stones.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Karen Shearer graduated from San Diego State University and began her career as a publicist for Capitol Records before moving to the Westwood One Radio Network circa 1980, where for the next decade she worked as a producer for Special Edition, a weekly program featuring the music of popular Black recording artists. During this period she also produced rock and country music programs for the Westwood One Radio Network. Shearer eventually left radio and the music business to produce wildlife programs for television.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection is arranged in four series:
Series 1. Special Edition (radio program)
* Subseries 1.1. Interview Transcripts
* Subseries 1.2. Program Transcripts
* Subseries 1.3. Artist Publicity Materials
* Subseries 1.4. Artist Photographs
Series 2. Rock Chronicles (radio program)
* Subseries 2.1. Interview and Program Transcripts
* Subseries 2.2. Publicity Materials (print and photographs)
Series 3. That's Country Music (radio program)
Series 4. General Research Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists primarily of 67 boxes of documents and photographs pertaining to three of the Westwood One Radio Network's programs: Special Edition, a program that featured interviews with and music by a wide range of R&B artists, including the Temptations, Kool & the Gang, Luther Vandross, Aretha Franklin, Jermaine Jackson, Stephanie Mills, and Rick James; Rock Chronicles, a program that featured interviews and music of many popular rock music artists of the era; and That's Country Music which includes similar materials for country music artists.

The materials include interview transcripts from the aforementioned programs, as well as press releases and black and white publicity photographs of many of the artists interviewed on the programs. Also included are transcripts of the radio programs and other special programs produced by Westwood One Radio on Jimi Hendrix, The Rolling Stones and Elvis Presley.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in IUCAT, the IU Libraries' online catalog. Materials about related topics, persons or places can be found by searching the catalog using these terms.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The LPs of the airchecks composing Westwood One's Special Edition radio show are available through the Indiana University, Archives of Traditional Music (Accession numbers 92-206-B--92-255-B; shelf numbers 12 J 6303--12 J 6402). Cassette copies of the LPs are available through the AAAMC as part of its "Westwood One : Special Edition Collection" (SC 70).

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by Karen Shearer to the AAAMC in June 2000.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright interests for this collection have not been transferred to Indiana University and duplication/publication requires the permission of the AAAMC as well as that of any rights holders. For more information, contact the AAAMC staff.

Thumbnails of all images in subseries "1.4. Special Edition Artist Photographs" are accessible online through Indiana University's Image Collections Online (ICO) as part of the AAAMC Black Radio Collections at http://webapp1.dlib.indiana.edu/images/splash.htm?scope=images/VAC9726. ICO also offers users additional search and browse features.

Archival materials from the Indiana University Archives of African American Music and Culture (AAAMC) are made available under an assertion of fair use (17 U.S.C. 107) for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. Indiana University respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyright interest for non-university records. It is the researcher’s responsibility to seek permission from the copyright owner and any other rights holders for any reuse of these images that extends beyond fair use or other statutory exemptions. Furthermore, responsibility for the determination of the copyright status and securing permission rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Karen Shearer collection, SC 129, Archives of African American Music and Culture, Indiana University, Bloomington.

did.unittitle: Chuck Berry Hail! Hail! Rock 'N' Roll

scopecontent.head: Description
scopecontent.p: "Chuck Berry Hail Hail Rock 'n' Roll" is a Delilah Films Production/A Taylor Hackford Film staring Chuck Berry and featuring such recording greats as Eric Clapton, Robert Cray, Etta James, Julian Lennon, Keith Richards and Linda Ronstadt. Keith Richards produced the music for the Universal Release, which was produced by Stephanie Bennett and directed by Taylor Hackford.

scopecontent.head: Description
scopecontent.p: LL Cool J, Jalil Hutchins, Jam Master Jay, and Kurtis Blow sitting on a motorbike and a forklift backstage at an event.

scopecontent.head: Description
scopecontent.p: GOLD ENRAPT: Def Jam/Columbia recording artist LL Cool J (center) shares the glory of RIAA gold for his debut album RADIO -- featuring the smash singles "I Can't Live Without My Radio," "Rock the Bells," and the brand-new "You'll Rock" -- with CBS Records Division President Al Teller (left) and Def Jam head and album producer Rick Rubin (right).

scopecontent.head: Description
scopecontent.p: Columbia recording artist Eddie Murphy leads a jammin' session at the video shoot for his new hot single "Put Your Mouth on Me" from his second musical CBS album, SO HAPPY. Eddie is putting his mouth on the mike with some help from his friends Johnny Gill (top left) and studio background singers. Producer extraordinaire Narada Michael Walden (top left on drums) work his magic on "Put Your Mouth on Me" and Greg Gold (top right) directed the music video for Propaganda Productions.
